thread.title: Canadian men advance to volleyball qualifier
thread.title_full: Canadian men advance to volleyball qualifier

title: Canadian men advance to volleyball qualifier
text:
Canadian men advance to volleyball qualifier By: Uncredited Report Error 
The Canadian men’s volleyball team has secured a spot at the regional Olympic qualifying tournament. 
Canada finished atop its NORCECA continental championship pool with a 2-0 record after sweeping Puerto Rico 3-0 (25-23, 25-17, 25-23) in Mexico on Wednesday. The win gave the Canadians a bye into the semifinals. The top four teams in the tournament advance to the Olympic qualifier. 
Setter Dustin Schneider of Brandon and left side Toon Van Lankvelt of Rivers did not play for Canada, which received 13 kills and two blocks from Gord Perrin and 10 blocks and an ace from Nicholas Hoag. 
Eddie Rivera had four kills and two blocks for Puerto Rico (1-1). 
The semifinals will take place on Friday.
